channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Blue Origin Lands Booster After Rocket Launch and Matches SpaceX’s Feat
item.description: The lower half of the New Glenn rocket set down on a platform in the Atlantic Ocean after lifting a small NASA Mars mission to space.

item.title: Palantir CEO Alex Karp says this type of prestigious college grad is doomed. People with expert knowledge will ‘make a lot more money’
item.description: The leader of the $439 billion tech company says those with niche knowledge will make “a lot more money” than Ivy League graduates with general expert...

item.title: Family of Fisherman Killed in U.S. Military Strike Says It Wants Justice
item.description: Colombia was a top U.S. ally in Latin America until the Trump administration began deadly strikes in international waters. Now, one family wants justi...

item.title: Southern California Is Forecast to Get Heavy Rain
item.description: Parts of Los Angeles County will be under evacuation warnings starting Thursday evening as a complex storm system moves in.

item.title: Top economist Mohamed El-Erian warns the AI bubble will ‘end in tears’ and credit ‘cockroaches’ abound
item.description: El-Erian argued that AI is a "rational bubble," but some have gone "beyond their comfort zone and beyond their ability to do due diligence."

item.title: Delta CEO slams ‘inexcusable’ shutdown that led to canceled flights and workers doing high-stress jobs without pay
item.description: "There was stress, there was strain, it was completely unnecessary," Ed Bastian told Yahoo Finance's Brian Sozzi.

item.title: Economist behind K-shaped economy sees a ‘sea of despair’ for the bottom 90% and a ‘crisis of confidence’ in the American dream
item.description: “At the bottom, this mindset develops where they recognize that they may never win, but that doesn't mean, ‘I can't help you lose,’” Peter Atwater sai...

item.title: Palantir CEO slams ‘parasitic’ critics calling the tech a surveillance tool: ‘Not only is patriotism right, patriotism will make you rich’
item.description: “Our project is to make America so strong we never fight,” he said. “That’s very different than being almost strong enough, so you always fight.”

item.title: Oklahoma Governor Commutes Inmate’s Death Sentence Just Before Execution
item.description: The death-row inmate, Tremane Wood, 46, had already had his last meal. It was only the second time Gov. Kevin Stitt has stepped in to stop an executio...

item.title: How France Remembers the November 2015 Terrorist Attacks in Paris
item.description: A decade ago, Islamic State militants killed 130 people in an assault that shocked France. Some survivors are still struggling, but for many of their ...

item.title: BBC Apologizes to Trump Over Film Edit but Declines to Pay Compensation
item.description: The BBC said it would not rebroadcast a misleadingly edited documentary but added, “We strongly disagree there is a basis for a defamation claim.”

item.title: An Alternative to Christian Nationalism
item.description: Once you put people into categorical boxes, you are inviting them to see history as a zero-sum conflict between this group and that one.

item.title: U.S. Officials Raise Concerns About Saudi Arabia’s Bid for F-35 Jets
item.description: A Pentagon intelligence report says China could try to acquire advanced F-35 technology in Saudi Arabia if the Trump administration sells jets to the ...

item.title: Of Books and Men
item.description: My colleague, the book critic Dwight Garner, tells us about “Flesh” by David Szalay, this year’s Booker Prize winner.
